chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: The Javadoc plugin provides an intuitive interface for accessing java documentation. The list of available javadoc trees can be populated in the plugin options pane (Plugins > Javadoc > Add/Remove Api Trees..., or Plugins > Plugin Options > Javadoc). Once populated, the documentation can be opened and searched through using the actions provided in the Javadoc plugin menu.

The standard java documentation can be found at http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp (under Additional Resources, look for "Java SE 6 Documentation"), and the jEdit api should have come with your jEdit installation.

To quickly search the api trees for a particular class, there are two available actions: "Search...", which opens up a dialog requesting the class name to search for, and the self-explanatory "Search word under cursor". Both require unqualified class names.
This plugin uses the InfoViewer plugin to display the documentation, which can be configured in Plugins > Plugin Options > InfoViewer.
